00:00:10:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:10:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:13:170000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:13:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:13:170000.Dialogue: We're gonna have to stop by Pottery Barn on the way to work. I bought these Star Wars sheets, but, they turned out to be much too stimulating to be compatible with a good night's sleep.

00:00:25:050000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:25:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:25:050000.Dialogue: I don't like the way Darth Vader stares at me.

00:00:29:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:29:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:30:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:30:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:30:130000.Dialogue: Just because your career's been stagnant for a few years, that's no reason to give up.

00:00:35:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:35:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:35:210000.Dialogue: I was up all night using the new free-electron laser for my X-ray diffraction experiment.

00:00:41:110000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:41:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:41:110000.Dialogue: Did the laser accidentally burn out your retinas?

00:00:44:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:44:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:45:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:45:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:45:060000.Dialogue: Then you can drive. Let's go.

00:00:49:120000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:49:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:49:120000.Dialogue: Ddn't I tell you I'd be working nights and that you'd have to make other arrangements?

00:00:53:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:53:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:55:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:55:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:57:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:00:57:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:00:080000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:01:00:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:01:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:01:01:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:130000.Dialogue: But how am I going to get to work? Take the bus. I can't take the bus anymore. They don't have seat belts, and they won't let you latch yourself to the seat with bungee cords.

00:01:10:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:01:10:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:10:200000.Dialogue: You tried to latch yourself to the seat with bungee cords?

00:01:13:180000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:01:13:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:17:000000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:01:17:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:17:000000.Dialogue: But for some reason, it alarmed the other passengers and I was asked to de-bus.

00:01:21:100000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:01:21:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:21:100000.Dialogue: You're a big boy. You'll figure it out.

00:01:24:020000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard enters, drops his keys in the bowl by the door, then collapses onto the settee. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area.
00:01:24:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:24:020000.Dialogue: Don't talk to me like I'm a child. Now, take me to return my Star Wars sheets!

00:01:45:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:45:150000.Dialogue: You have to drive me to work.

00:01:47:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:47:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, I really don't think I do.

00:01:50:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:50:230000.Dialogue: But I don't drive, and I can't take the bus.

00:01:53:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:53:090000.Dialogue: You'll be fine as long as you don't do that bungee cord thing, okay?

00:01:58:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:58:230000.Dialogue: Didn't you recently state that you and I are friends?

00:02:06:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:06:040000.Dialogue: Then I hereby invoke what I'm given to understand is an integral part of the implied covenant of friendship.

00:02:21:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:21:120000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I didn't realize I was interrupting your morning prayers.

00:02:54:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:54:070000.Dialogue: Thank you for driving me to work.

00:02:56:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:56:130000.Dialogue: You know this is my day off?

00:02:58:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:58:100000.Dialogue: Oh, good. I'm not keeping you from anything.

00:03:04:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:04:090000.Dialogue: Your check engine light is on. Typically that's an indicator to, you know, check your engine.

00:03:12:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:12:050000.Dialogue: It's fine. It's been on for, like, a month.

00:03:15:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:15:190000.Dialogue: Actually, that would be all the more reason to... you know, check your engine.

00:03:22:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:22:150000.Dialogue: If it were fine, the light wouldn't be on. That's why the manufacturer installed that light, to let you know it's not fine.

00:03:31:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:31:140000.Dialogue: Is there a check the 'check engine light' light?

00:03:38:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:38:210000.Dialogue: Studies have shown that performing tasks such as eating, talking on a cell phone or drinking coffee while driving reduces one's reaction time by the same factor as an ounce of alcohol.

00:03:55:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:55:070000.Dialogue: You're going up Euclid Avenue? Leonard takes Los Robles Avenue.

00:04:02:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:02:140000.Dialogue: Euclid Avenue is shorter as the crow flies, but it has speed bumps, which appreciably increase point-to-point drive time, making it the less efficient choice. But you have the conn.

00:04:17:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:17:130000.Dialogue: If you're not going to slow down for the speed bumps, I withdraw my previous objection.

00:04:23:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:23:200000.Dialogue: Here's a fun question. Do you know what the most common street name is?

00:04:31:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:31:200000.Dialogue: It's Second Street. You'd think it would be First Street, but in most towns, First Street eventually gets renamed to something else. You know, like Main Street, Broad Street. Michigan Avenue.

00:04:44:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:44:000000.Dialogue: Leonard and I often use our commute time to exercise our minds with brain-teasers like that. We also play games. Would you like to play one?

00:05:01:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:01:020000.Dialogue: Okay. I'll say an element, and you say an element whose name starts with the last letter of the one I said, okay? I'll start.

00:05:11:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:11:170000.Dialogue: Helium. Now, you could say mercury. That would give me a y. Very clever. That's a tough one.

00:05:24:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:24:050000.Dialogue: So I go with ytterbium, which gets you back to m. So you go molybdenum, and I say magnesium. You say manganese. I say europium, and, then, you're left with mendelevium, and... there are no more m's because I believe that meitnerium should still be called ekairidium. So, congratulations. You win.

00:05:50:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:50:200000.Dialogue: Why don't we just have a little quiet time now?

00:06:00:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:00:080000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I'm finding your reckless nonchalance regarding the check-engine light to be very troubling.

00:06:12:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:12:150000.Dialogue: I have to tell you that while I do have a theoretical understanding of the workings of an internal combustion engine, I'm not sure I'm capable of performing diagnostics.

00:06:22:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:22:230000.Dialogue: Okay. I'll give it a shot.

00:06:39:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:39:230000.Dialogue: There you are. I'm ready to go home.

00:06:49:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:49:010000.Dialogue: I told you, I only have access to the free-electron laser at night. I can't drive you for the next few weeks.

00:06:53:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:53:190000.Dialogue: No, you said you couldn't drive me to work. This is from work.

00:07:00:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:00:090000.Dialogue: No, just for the fun of it, I'm gonna take his side.

00:07:05:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:05:010000.Dialogue: Now, how do you propose I get home?

00:07:07:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:07:110000.Dialogue: How did you get here in the first place?

00:07:09:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:09:080000.Dialogue: Penny. But I sense that's no longer an option.

00:07:14:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:14:160000.Dialogue: I need to get to the laser lab. You're just gonna have to find someone else to take you home.

00:07:26:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:26:030000.Dialogue: Damn, I picked the wrong side.

00:07:34:120000.Scene: Howard’s motor scooter. Howard is driving, Sheldon is on the back clutching him for dear life and screaming.
00:07:34:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:43:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:43:220000.Dialogue: Why did Howard leave you in the middle of the road anyway?

00:07:51:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:51:180000.Dialogue: Whether or not he was trying to kill me.

00:07:54:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:54:100000.Dialogue: For the record, I maintain he was.

00:08:01:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:01:000000.Dialogue: But I'm not going home. It's Wednesday. Wednesday's new comic book day. We have to go to the comic book store.

00:08:07:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:07:000000.Dialogue: Then, we have to stop at Souplantation; it's creamy tomato soup day.

00:08:11:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:11:020000.Dialogue: And Radio Shack. There's a sale on triple-A batteries.

00:08:14:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:14:130000.Dialogue: Plus, we have to go to Pottery Barn and return my Star Wars sheets.

00:08:18:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment, she opens the door, Sheldon is stood outside with his Star Wars sheets.
00:08:18:070000.Speaker: Raj

00:08:20:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment, she opens the door, Sheldon is stood outside with his Star Wars sheets.
00:08:20:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:20:170000.Dialogue: You want to go to Pottery Barn first?

00:08:22:000000.Scene: Penny’s apartment, she opens the door, Sheldon is stood outside with his Star Wars sheets.

00:08:34:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment, she opens the door, Sheldon is stood outside with his Star Wars sheets.
00:08:34:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:34:100000.Dialogue: Can you drive me to Pottery Barn?

00:08:42:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:08:42:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:42:180000.Dialogue: Maybe if I turn off the night-light, I can keep the sheets.

00:08:58:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:08:58:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:01:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:01:040000.Speaker: All

00:09:03:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:03:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:05:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:05:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:09:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:09:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:09:230000.Dialogue: Don't look at me like that. Everybody knows that's my spot.

00:09:19:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:19:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:19:100000.Dialogue: You know that we care about you.

00:09:21:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:21:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:21:220000.Dialogue: And it's because we care about you that we've decided we have to speak up.

00:09:30:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:30:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:30:130000.Dialogue: You're hurting the people around you, sweetie.

00:09:32:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:32:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:32:210000.Dialogue: So we made you an appointment, and we want you to keep it.

00:09:38:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:38:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:38:080000.Dialogue: Department of Motor Vehicles New Driver Handbook?

00:09:45:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:45:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:45:080000.Dialogue: But I don't have a problem.

00:09:48:160000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:48:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:48:160000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you need to learn how to drive.

00:09:51:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:51:100000.Speaker: Howard

00:09:55:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:55:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:55:050000.Dialogue: Penny's taking you to the DMV. I'm going to bed.

00:09:57:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:09:57:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:02:160000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:02:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:10:05:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:05:170000.Speaker: Penny

00:10:07:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:07:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:07:190000.Dialogue: We have to stop at Pottery Barn.

00:10:11:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:11:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:14:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:14:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:10:16:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:16:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:19:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:19:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:19:130000.Dialogue: I want to go to the comic book store.

00:10:41:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon enters from the bedroom area. Everyone else is present.
00:10:41:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:47:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:47:080000.Dialogue: I still don't see why I need a driver's license. Albert Einstein never had a driver's license.

00:10:53:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:53:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, but Albert Einstein didn't make me wet myself at 40 miles an hour.

00:10:59:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:59:020000.Dialogue: Yeah, and I never wanted to kick Albert Einstein in the nuts.

00:11:06:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:06:030000.Dialogue: I gotta ask, why didn't you just get a license at 16 like everybody else?

00:11:15:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:15:010000.Dialogue: Examing perturbative amplitudes in N=4 supersymmetric theories leading to a re-examination of the ultraviolet properties of multi-loop N=8 supergravity using modern twistor theory.

00:11:28:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:28:160000.Dialogue: Well, how about when you were 17?

00:11:32:160000.Speaker: DMV Lady
00:11:32:160000.Dialogue: Take this to the testing area, put your name at the top, sign the bottom, answer the questions, bring it back. Next.

00:11:46:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:46:040000.Dialogue: I'm actually more of a theorist.

00:11:50:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:50:150000.Dialogue: The application in your hand. Give it to her.

00:11:58:040000.Speaker: DMV Lady
00:11:58:040000.Dialogue: Take this to the testing area, put your name at the top, sign the bottom, answer the questions, bring it back. Next!

00:12:03:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:050000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but I have some concerns about these questions.

00:12:07:220000.Speaker: DMV Lady
00:12:07:220000.Dialogue: Look at that sign up there. Does it say I give a damn?

00:12:18:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:18:210000.Dialogue: Just look. This first question makes no sense. How many car lengths should you leave in front of you when driving? There's no possible way to answer that. A car length is not a standardized unit of measure.

00:12:35:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:35:010000.Dialogue: It's C. Just put down C.

00:12:37:200000.Speaker: DMV Lady
00:12:37:200000.Dialogue: Listen to that little girl, honey. Put C. Next!

00:12:40:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:40:180000.Dialogue: Wait! Hang on. Look at this next question.

00:12:42:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:42:010000.Dialogue: Why are you arguing with the DMV?

00:12:47:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:47:020000.Dialogue: How else are they going to learn?

00:12:51:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:51:020000.Dialogue: Look... question two: When are roadways most slippery? Now, there are 3 answers, none of which are correct. The correct answer is when covered by a film of liquid sufficient to reduce the coefficient of static friction between the tire and the road to essentially zero, but not so deep as to introduce a new source of friction.

00:13:12:220000.Speaker: DMV Lady
00:13:12:220000.Dialogue: Here's your learner's permit. Go away.

00:13:16:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:16:130000.Dialogue: But I'm not done. I have many additional concerns about these questions.

00:13:20:050000.Speaker: DMV Lady
00:13:20:050000.Dialogue: Don't make me climb over this counter.

00:13:32:150000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:13:32:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:32:150000.Dialogue: That's... it. Let's boot it up.

00:13:35:060000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:13:35:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:37:090000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:13:37:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:37:090000.Dialogue: This is a state-of-the-art simulator. I adapted it from something a friend of mine designed for the army.

00:13:42:040000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:13:42:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:42:040000.Dialogue: Is that why I appear to be in downtown Fallujah behind the wheel of an up-armored Humvee?

00:13:47:090000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:13:47:090000.Speaker: Howard

00:13:50:030000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:13:50:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:50:030000.Dialogue: Let's see... Bradley tank... transport truck... Batmobile...

00:13:57:150000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:13:57:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:57:150000.Dialogue: Here we go. Red 2006 Ford Taurus on the streets of Pasadena. What?

00:14:04:230000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:04:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:04:230000.Dialogue: Statistically, red cars are stopped by police far more often than any other color. I don't want any hassles with the fuzz.

00:14:12:150000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:12:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:12:150000.Dialogue: Fine, what color do you want?

00:14:14:220000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:14:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:220000.Dialogue: You know the pale blue of Luke Skywalker's lightsaber?

00:14:20:040000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:20:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:24:220000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:24:220000.Speaker: Howard

00:14:28:020000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:28:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:28:020000.Dialogue: Okay, now, what you want to do first is turn on the ignition and shift into drive.

00:14:32:060000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:32:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:32:060000.Dialogue: I haven't fastened my seat belt yet.

00:14:36:210000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:36:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:49:020000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:49:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:51:120000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:51:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:51:120000.Dialogue: What if a simulated van rear-ends me?

00:14:53:140000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:14:53:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:53:140000.Dialogue: I'll hit you in the face with a pillow.

00:15:04:210000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:15:04:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:04:210000.Dialogue: Okay, now shift into drive. Pull out slowly into traffic.

00:15:11:220000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:15:11:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:11:220000.Dialogue: Watch out, watch, watch out for the pedestrians!

00:15:15:090000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:15:15:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:15:090000.Dialogue: Wait-- slow-- Hit the brakes! The brakes!

00:15:30:210000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is setting up a large kit of high tech equipment.
00:15:30:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:35:180000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:15:35:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:39:220000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:15:39:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:43:230000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:15:43:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:47:050000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:15:47:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:47:050000.Dialogue: How did you manage to get on the 2d floor of the Glendale Galleria?

00:15:52:020000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:15:52:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:52:020000.Dialogue: I don't know. I was on the Pasadena freeway. I missed my exit, flew off the overpass, and one thing led to another.

00:16:01:110000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:01:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:01:110000.Dialogue: Maybe you want to give it a rest and try again tomorrow.

00:16:04:220000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:04:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:15:010000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:15:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:18:070000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:18:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:18:070000.Dialogue: Remind me to compliment Wolowitz on the software. It's amazingly detailed.

00:16:24:010000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:24:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:24:010000.Dialogue: So wait, you're just gonna give up?

00:16:26:060000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:26:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:26:060000.Dialogue: No, I'm not giving up. I never give up.

00:16:30:120000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:30:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:30:120000.Dialogue: So, what is it you're doing?

00:16:32:190000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:32:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:40:080000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:40:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:40:080000.Dialogue: I'm clearly too evolved for driving.

00:16:47:030000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:47:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:49:200000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:49:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:49:200000.Dialogue: Have you ever wondered why my little toes and lateral incisors are significantly smaller than the average for someone of my size?

00:16:59:080000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:16:59:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:59:080000.Dialogue: I wonder a lot of things about you. But not-not that.

00:17:03:180000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:03:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:03:180000.Dialogue: Well, those are indicators that I'm farther along the evolutionary scale than the average human.

00:17:07:150000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:07:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:09:120000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:09:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:09:120000.Dialogue: Hold on. I'm not gonna go so far as to say that I represent a distinct new stage in humankind-- you know, a homo novus, if you will.

00:17:18:220000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:18:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:22:130000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:22:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:22:130000.Dialogue: But I am convinced that the reason I cannot master the plebeian task of driving is because I'm not meant to.

00:17:28:230000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:28:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:28:230000.Dialogue: Yes, you are. You're meant to learn how to drive. Please learn how to drive!

00:17:34:010000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:34:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:34:010000.Dialogue: I'm meant for greater things, like unraveling the mysteries of the universe, not determing when it's safe to pass a stopped school bus on a country road.

00:17:44:170000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:44:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:49:100000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:49:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:49:100000.Dialogue: Fine. Assuming that everything you say is true, how does the biologically superior homo novus get to work tomorrow morning?

00:17:57:210000.Scene: The same, only Sheldon and Leonard are present. Sheldon is practicing. There are sounds of squealing tyres and brakes and general panic and mayhem.
00:17:57:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:01:080000.Scene: A corridor in the university. Sheldon emerges from his office in a shower cap and bathrobe. The others are turning the corner.
00:18:01:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:01:080000.Dialogue: Well, hang in there. Maybe you'll evolve into something with wings.

00:18:17:110000.Scene: A corridor in the university. Sheldon emerges from his office in a shower cap and bathrobe. The others are turning the corner.
00:18:17:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:19:030000.Scene: A corridor in the university. Sheldon emerges from his office in a shower cap and bathrobe. The others are turning the corner.
00:18:19:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:19:030000.Dialogue: Good morning. Is there some new kind of casual Friday I don't know about?

00:18:25:210000.Scene: A corridor in the university. Sheldon emerges from his office in a shower cap and bathrobe. The others are turning the corner.
00:18:25:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:28:120000.Scene: A corridor in the university. Sheldon emerges from his office in a shower cap and bathrobe. The others are turning the corner.
00:18:28:120000.Speaker: Howard

00:18:30:040000.Scene: A corridor in the university. Sheldon emerges from his office in a shower cap and bathrobe. The others are turning the corner.
00:18:30:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:30:040000.Dialogue: Since he won't take the bus and he's too evolved to drive, he decided it would be easier to sleep in his office and shower in the radiation lab until I'm finished with my experiment.

00:18:39:150000.Scene: A corridor in the university. Sheldon emerges from his office in a shower cap and bathrobe. The others are turning the corner.
00:18:39:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:39:150000.Dialogue: But you finished your experiment a week ago.
